DataElement.preferredDefinition: The descriptive results and/or status of the LVEF after administration of a treadmill stress test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the left ventricle ejection fraction heart test._the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.
The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of a left ventricular ejection fraction assessment during a treadmill stress test.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
